description.narrative: The intervention's long term objective is to enhance the democratisation process in Liberia through improved electoral institutions and processes. The intervention's intended outcome is to strengthen the capacity of National Elections Commission (NEC) and core electoral stakeholders to conduct their core activities in an impartial, transparent and sustainable manner and successfully carry out scheduled electoral processes within the electoral cycle 2015-2018.

UNDP har inkommit till ambassaden med en ansökan om stöd, MSEK 25, under 2016-2018 till UNDP's pågående projekt om valstöd, Election project 2015-2018, som idag finansieras av UNDP och EU.
Insatsen har som långsiktigt mål att stärka demokratiseringsprocessen i Liberia genom förbättrade valinstitutioner och valprocesser. Projektmålet är att stärka kapaciteten hos Liberias valkommission och andra nyckelaktörer att utföra sitt mandat på ett opartiskt, öppet och hållbart sätt, och att genomföra planerade valprocesser under perioden 2015-2018. Specifikt gäller det president och allmänna val i oktober 2017. Utöver stöd till valkommissionen, innehåller insatsen bl.a. kompetensutveckling av politiska partier, liberianska polisen och CSO i valprocessen och fredlig konfliktslösning, utbildning av röstberättigade, inklusive kvinnor och ungdomar, och finansiering av valmaterial. UNDP genomför insatsen i nära samarbete med Liberias valkommission och civila samhället.
Projektets totala kostnad är ca MSEK 135 under perioden 2015-2018. Projektet bygger på tidigare fas av stöd till valen 2011 i Liberia, med bl.a. svensk finansiering.

UNDP has submitted to the Embassy of Sweden in Monrovia a request for support to implement the on-going "Election Project 2015-2018" which is today funded by UNDP and EU.
The Project expected outcome is: To strengthen the capacity of National Elections Commission (NEC) and core electoral stakeholders to conduct their core activities in an impartial, transparent and sustainable manner and successfully carry out scheduled electoral processes within the electoral cycle 2015-2018. Presidential and general elections in October 2017 will be in focus for the support.

description.narrative: Summary of key achievements of the 2015-2018 UNDP Elections Project: In building human and institutional capacities of the National Elections Commission, the project succeeded in rolling out training programmes such as two Building Resources in Democracies, Governance and Elections (BRIDGE) strategic and financial planning, Civic and voter education and gender sensitivity sessions that enhanced stakeholders’ (political parties, women, youths etc.) individual roles and responsibilities towards the conduct of credible elections in Liberia on the one hand, and to strengthen the institutional capacity of the NEC, on the other. On voter registration, there is evidence that the project succeeded in reviewing and updating the voter registration system of Optical Mark Recognition (OMR) and procured equipment (cameras and solar panel kits) that helped facilitate the work of elections officials and other stakeholders. The number of staff (13,300 to the initial target of 8,400) received adequate training, that was also gender sensitive, for the voter registration phase 1 and phase 2 voter exhibition periods in 2017. In enhancing women's political participation and leadership, several gender sensitive policies and strategies were developed that will serve as reference points in the promotion of gender equality and women’s empowerment. For instance, the NEC Gender mainstreaming policy was drafted that helped provide guidance to the advancement and promotion of gender equality in electoral processes. However, it is still assessed that the project would have done more on gender related work. In terms of building capacities of political parties, the project established a Platform for the Inter-Party Consultative Committee (IPCC) to function, which helped political parties to dialogue and collaborate on critical elections issues resulting in their commitment to ensure peaceful elections in Liberia. The project built the capacity of political parties in electoral administration and management leading to their commitment not only to peaceful elections but to help improve the work of the NEC through collaboration and partnership building. The project strengthened the capacity of the security coordinating mechanism and operational elections security plan through training sessions. The Liberia National Police (LNP) benefited immensely from these training sessions as evidence in their vigilance and policing of all of the elections related activities, e.g. resulting in peaceful elections in 2017. For the 2017 elections, it was seen that in 90 percent of polling precincts observed, security personnel were present during counting. This resulted in ensuring that the elections were free from violence, a credit to the support provided by the project. Regarding Civic and Voter Education (CVE), the project supported the NEC to undertake the initiative to create a CVE toolkit and it resulted in the increase in knowledge of elections stakeholders on the processes on voting in elections and increase in their participation in the electoral process. The project supported the production of civic education products and distributed in advance of the general elections in 2017. CVE/curriculum development for effective participation and conduct of successful elections in Liberia remains a challenge. In terms of the work around Electoral legal framework and the constitutional review, the project provided support for the codification of the electoral legislation, which was distributed among citizens that impacted on their understanding of the new law. Also critical was that electoral complaints were concluded in a timely fashion and the project’s organized information sessions increased skills and awareness of key stakeholders on electoral dispute resolution. The training of 19 magistrates resulted in fair hearing and adherence to due process that impacted on the credibility of the electoral process. Fundamental legal processes leading to electoral reform were successfully initiated setting the basis for implementation of election observers’ recommendations in the ensuing years. Finally, the project supported the successful conduct of national elections through logistics and operational support provided to NEC and core electoral stakeholders. This is largely attributed to the institutional and human capacity development of the managerial, professional, administrative and logistical capacities of NEC staff, which had a positive impact in the management of the 2017 elections, which witnessed little or no outright contention of election results. NEC and its partners should take steps to ensure that costs of future elections are minimized while at the same time upholding the integrity and professional standards of the electoral process.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
